de.tum.in.tumcampus.activities.generic

Class ActivityForAccessingTumOnline

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener, uk.co.senab.actionbarpulltorefresh.library.listeners.OnRefreshListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalendarActivity, ChatRoomsSearchActivity, GradesActivity, LecturesAppointmentsActivity, LecturesDetailsActivity, OrganisationActivity, OrganisationDetailsActivity, PersonsDetailsActivity, TuitionFeesActivity, WizNavCheckTokenActivity

    public abstract class ActivityForAccessingTumOnline
extends ProgressActivity
implements TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener
    Generic class which handles all basic tasks to communicate with TUMOnline. It implements the TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener in order to receive data from TUMOnline and implements a rich user feedback with error progress and token related layouts.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActivityForAccessingTumOnline

        public ActivityForAccessingTumOnline(TUMOnlineConst method,
                             int layoutId)
        Standard constructor for ActivityForAccessingTumOnline. The given layout must include a progress_layout, failed_layout, no_token_layout and an error_layout. If the Activity should support Pull-To-Refresh it can also contain a PullToRefreshLayout named ptr_layout
        Parameters:
        method - A identifier specifying what kind of data should be fetched from TumOnline
        layoutId - Resource id of the xml layout that should be used to inflate the activity

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class ProgressActivity

      • requestFetch

        public void requestFetch()
        Starts fetching data from TumOnline in background TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener.onFetch(String) gets called if data was fetched successfully. If an error occurred it is handled by ActivityForAccessingTumOnline.

      • requestFetch

        public void requestFetch(boolean force)
        Starts fetching data from TumOnline in background TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener.onFetch(String) gets called if data was fetched successfully. If an error occurred it is handled by ActivityForAccessingTumOnline.
        Parameters:
        force - Force reload of content

      • onFetchCancelled

        public void onFetchCancelled()
        Description copied from interface: TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener
        Called if the fetch was canceled by the user. This should be implemented to cancel the HTMLRequest and clear all previous fetching data.
        Specified by:
        onFetchCancelled in interface TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener

      • onFetchError

        public void onFetchError(java.lang.String errorReason)
        Description copied from interface: TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener
        if the fetchInteractive method will result in null or there is no internet connection then this method will be called
        Specified by:
        onFetchError in interface TUMOnlineRequestFetchListener
        Parameters:
        errorReason - the reason why the request failed (localized)
